title: PHYSICIAN, HEAL MYSELF!
description: When Deductive Logico came to in a private hospital, his knew his injuries wouldn't hurt half as much as the bill. But his surgeon, Dr. Crimson, offered a trade: if he solved another patient's murder, they'd give him a two percent discount. He immediately agreed.

suspects.name: OFFICER COPPER
suspects.description: The best part of being a policewoman criminal is that you can cut out the middleman and fail to investigate your own crimes.

suspects.name: DR. CRIMSON
suspects.description: She's the smartest doctor she's ever met, according to her, and she's probably right. Yeah, she smokes, but if she gets cancer, she'll find a cure.

suspects.name: SISTER LAPIS
suspects.description: A nun who travels the world, doing God's work on His dime. Her habit is cashmere, and her habit is spending.

weapons.name: A VIAL OF ACID
weapons.description: According to the label, you should not take a sip of this, no matter how tempting it seems.

weapons.name: A HEAVY MICROSCOPE
weapons.description: The slides are so tiny, but the microscope's so heavy!

weapons.name: A SURGICAL SCALPEL
weapons.description: Somehow, it being smaller makes it seem more dangerous.

locations.name: THE PARKING LOT
locations.description: An enormous parking lot with uniformed valets parking luxury sedans.

locations.name: THE ROOF
locations.description: Huge AC units and other industrial equipment cover the roof, providing a number of excellent hiding spots.

locations.name: THE GIFT SHOP
locations.description: This hospital is so nice you can buy jewelry at the gift shop. But don't worry: there's a discount rack, too.

clues: A vial of acid was certainly not on the roof. (They had acid-detecting sensors there.)
The suspect who was in the gift shop had light brown eyes.
Officer Copper had a weapon with a label on it reading DO NOT DRINK.
Surprisingly, Dr. Crimson did not bring her surgical scalpel (or any surgical scalpel, for that matter).
The patient's body was found beneath a luxury sedan.
